intro: Rosa agrestis f. stenorhyncha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wild rose, is a botanical variant of the wild rose species. It is characterized by its slender, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its growth habit is generally shrub-like, with thorny stems and dense foliage. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
